tweets.text: @JackPerksPhoto @WildTroutTrust @Trent_R_Trust @TrentGateway @Nottswildlife @EnvAgencyMids @lte_catchment Nice footage Jack. Are they less easily spooked when focused on spawing or are you not actually in the water with them?
Pls do join ‚Äòour Jane‚Äô from @EnvAgencyNW and @nwgrnd_chrissy & you also get to hear from the ‚Äòtour de force‚Äô that is @stormwater_jo ! https://t.co/o2itpzAZmx

Listen up @DefraGovUK, @NaturalEngland, @EnvAgency...following the passing of the Agriculture Act 2020 into law, I'm keen on launching a #BackTheBuffer campaign, calling for the implementation of buffer strips around UK waterways. This will provide a number of important benefits.

Our staff are out and about in the #Midlands like here in Tamworth where we are testing pump equipment in readiness for #winter. Please check your #flood risk
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/mRRKsluR4c

@EnvAgencyAnglia warns of possible flooding check out their warnings for our coastline here
https://t.co/tETwgwtk1D

Brown trout spawning in the centre of Nottingham not something I would of expected!
@WildTroutTrust @Trent_R_Trust @TrentGateway @Nottswildlife @EnvAgencyMids @lte_catchment https://t.co/Qkns405Fhb

After two successful North West regional events, don't miss the upcoming webinar on #FloodResistance on 24 November, where speakers from the @EnvAgency, @TheFloodHub, @ArcadisUK & Stormwater Shepherds will discuss the work they are currently doing. https://t.co/x7tR6l8THB https://t.co/9z1usdEmMd

Our work at Dovecliff Weir #Derbyshire reached a milestone on #WorldFishMigrationDay when we temporarily diverted the #RiverDove to gain safe access to remove the weir. 

Now the real work begins #damremoval. Latest update https://t.co/ZzFIB3LmHG https://t.co/WZXdZWSoSX

tweets.text:
Phase 2 works are ongoing on the #Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme and are progressing well. 

Here‚Äôs a sneak peak of the new footpath at the Sands Centre. 

Want to know more? Take a look at the FloodHub https://t.co/gxCTOEbsAK https://t.co/Q3NQQ7C5aZ

Great to see coverage of our fisheries team in @warringtonnews! Their prompt response, alongside Warrington Anglers Association, to an incident of low oxygen levels, saved the lives of a large number of fish at High Legh Fisheries. 

Read all about it üëâ https://t.co/ODcahTYAei https://t.co/4b0fA6Myuo

River users in Northumberland are being asked to ‚Äòcheck, clean, dry‚Äô to help prevent the spread of diseases & safeguard the future of native white-clawed crayfish in the River Wansbeck after increased reports of invasive signal crayfish in the River Coquet https://t.co/cAPO74ouLi https://t.co/ZSoZOnuIpu
